title: Catalogued Resource schema
description: Unified Metadata schema for a Catalogued Resource

accessRights.description: A rights statement that concerns how the distribution is accessed.

description.description: A concise narrative of the content of a catalogued resource.
Text used when displaying details of the distribution.

format.description: The IANA media type, or file format, type, or extention, of the distribution file.

title.description: Text used when displaying links to or labelling the distribution.

type.description: The distribution type. For example: file, documentation, service

url.description: The location from which the resource can be downloaded or accessed

identifier.description: A unique number, code, or reference value assigned to a resource within the catalogue.

keyword.description: Terms (words or phrases) assigned to describe a resource.

modified.description: The date on which the metadata was created or last updated.

publisher.description: The entity responsible for making the catalogued resource publicly available.

relatedResource.description: Another resource that is related to the current catalogued resource

identifier.description: A unique number, code, or reference value assigned the related resource.

relationshipType.description: How the related resource is related to the curreent resource. For example 'Servers'

title.description: Text used when labelling the related resource.

securityClassification.description: An information security designation that identifies the minimum level of protection assigned to an information resource.

status.description: Lifecycle status of resource within catalogue

supplierIdentifier.description: A unique code, url, or reference value assigned to a catalogued resource a third party (supplier's) system.

theme.description: A controlled or filter term that expresses the broad topical content of a resource.

title.description: Text used when displaying links to or labelling the resource.

type.description: The type of metadata record. Used to identify actions needed to process the metadata
